abstract.para: This topic focuses on updating your system using &cockpit;.

topic.para: To update your system, proceed as follows:

step.para: Navigate to the Software updates page.
Click Check for Updates icon to get a list of new package updates and patches available for your system. We recommend installing the patches marked as important as soon as possible.
Now you can update your system either with immediate reboot, or the reboot might be postponed:
Click Install all updates to install all updates updates. By default, all available updates are selected.
To install specific updates, select Unselect all and then select the required updates and click Install selected updates.
After the installation is complete, you can reboot your system or click Ignore to postpone the reboot.

note.para: When the Web Console is restarted, you will no longer see progress information. However, the update process will continue in the background. Reconnect to continue watching the update process.

step.para: To reboot the system after installation, enable the Reboot after completion toggle button. By default, the Reboot after completion toggle button is disabled. You must reboot the system to activate the snapshot with updates. If you perform further changes without rebooting the system beforehand, a new snapshot will be created from the same point as the snapshots with updates. Therefore, the new snapshot will not include the updates.
To view the installed package information, click Package information.
In the Reboot window, enter the message for the logged in users and select the time delay for the reboot.
You can view the update history in the Update history section.
